title: Excellent app
comment: Best one!
Does exactly what you want it to

title: Perfect mirror pwdhash app
comment: Couldn't ask for better pwdhash app. Thanks!

title: Excellent tool
comment: However, the underlying algorithm:  PwdHash could be improved by hashing the password both with the site and a saved ID.  This would inhibit attacks where a site that doesn't salt has duplicate passwords.
Excellent app. Highly recommend.

title: Used to work fine
comment: But now passwords don't match the PwdHash site. Update: now works again, perhaps I missed something.

There was nothing changed in this app, but we discovered some possible incompatibilities between various pwdhash implementations and browsers when using long passwords. See http://goo.gl/ofxUFr for details.

title: Very useful!
comment: Improves pas sword security in an easy way.

title: Great app!
comment: What would make it perfect is that it treats URL's as case insensitive. Prevents wrong passwords and confusion
Thanks for the feedback, I will consider this. It would be a small compatibility breakage with pwdhash.com, though. But the advantages probably outweigh this.

title: Wonderful
comment: I love it! The only improvement I'd suggest would be trimming the url to the domain part when "share" feature is used.
This has been implemented in version 1.3.2. Thanks for the great feedback.
Great implementation
Perfect
The best!

title: Does exactly what it says!
comment: While other features would be nice like the ability to store the passwords or account names would be nice. It would be even better yet if there was either an online version or minimally a windows version for when I don't have my phone.

There is an online version available at pwdhash.com and there are also various browser extensions for Firefox, Chrome and others. Just look in the relevant add-on stores. There is also a Windows 8 version by me if somebody is interested.

title: Can't specify password length
comment: I use long generated passwords but this app doesn't let me generate them.

As the main purpose of this app ist to stay compatible with pwdhash.com and the various browser plugins I won't add that feature, sorry. But the output password's length depends on the length of the input password.

title: Best in clasz
comment: Can be used independent of browser—like for Facebook app. Best in class. Only improvement might be a toggle for a stored suffix.
Works well. Shows password helps me identify if typed wrong or to type into another device.
